message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating 3D shape from 2D correspondences in a single image, which is a common problem in computer vision. The paper proposes a sparse representation approach and a convex relaxation algorithm to solve the problem. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also deals with shape variability and model inference, which are related to graphics and machine learning, respectively. Therefore, cs.GR (Graphics) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also likely sub-categories. The paper proposes a robust model to handle gross errors in the 2D correspondences, which is related to robust statistics and outlier detection. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper demonstrates the applicability of the proposed method to recover 3D human poses and car models from single images, which is related to multimedia and computer graphics. Therefore, cs.MM (Multimedia) is also a likely sub-category.
